finding_aid_filing_title: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Affirmative Action Files (N. Lee Cook), Series 8
finding_aid_title: A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Affirmative Action (N. Lee Cook), Series 8

subnotes.content: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at <extref href="http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php">http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php</extref>

RAC users must abide by all applicable provisions of U.S. copyright law. Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

Detailed finding aids for each series of this collection are available:

<extref href="../FA353/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Appointments Office (FA353)</extref>

<extref href="../FA354/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Assembly and Senate Memos (FA354)</extref>

<extref href="../FA355/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Joseph H. Boyd (FA355)</extref>

<extref href="../FA358/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Counsel's Office (FA358)</extref>

<extref href="../FA359/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, New York State Committee to Reelect the President (FA359)</extref>

<extref href="../FA360/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Jerry A. Danzig (FA360)</extref>

<extref href="../FA361/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Executive Chamber (FA361)</extref>

<extref href="../FA362/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, 55th Street (FA362)</extref>

<extref href="../FA364/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Arthur Massolo (FA364)</extref>

<extref href="../FA242/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Hugh Morrow (FA242)</extref>

<extref href="../FA365/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, New York Office (FA365)</extref>

<extref href="../FA366/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Civil Service Resolutions (Charles H. Palmer) (FA366)</extref>

<extref href="../FA367/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Political Files (FA367)</extref>

<extref href="../FA368/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Press Office (FA368)</extref>

<extref href="../FA369/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Public Relations (FA369)</extref>

<extref href="../FA370/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Departmental Reports (FA370)</extref>

<extref href="../FA371/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, William J. Ronan (FA371)</extref>

<extref href="../FA372/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Speeches (FA372)</extref>

<extref href="../FA373/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Diane Van Wie (FA373)</extref>

<extref href="../FA374/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Ann C. Whitman, Gubernatorial (FA374)</extref>

<extref href="../FA375/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, Gene Wyckoff (FA375)</extref>

<extref href="../FA376/overview">Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial Records, New York Republican State Fund Raising Reports (FA376)</extref>

NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains a portion of the office files of N. Lee Cook, a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. They document official activities in the execution of his duties as a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration, political campaigns, and/or Rockefeller's personal activities. However, unless a document is specifically addressed to or from Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document addressed to him, it should not be assumed he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that staff files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller that were never shown to him.

SCOPE AND CONTENT

This small series contains a portion of the files of N. Lee Cook, who served as a Program Assistant for Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller. These files are specifically related to Affirmative Action Programs. The majority of the files contain significant documentation of the Affirmative Action Program of Greater Buffalo (BAAP) and the work undertaken by that organization in 1970 and 1971. Primarily, these files deal with construction issues and equal employment opportunities, as well as affirmative action concerns on construction sites around New York State.
